hand.section:
To S
r
Edw. Nor Ma
r
28 1593

page.lettertext:
fol.30r
To S
r
Edward Norris 1593
Sir I have moved youer suites to
e
Councell of est[ate
who]
are
are
verye well pleased
at
Sir John Poleis
Cornet [.]
sent unto you: but beinge at this present before
[Gertru]
denber
g
ch
and
e enemie expected to releive
e town[e they]
neither finde it
do to
fitt to dimi nishe their forces [.]
otherwyse but weake: and thoughe
e shoulde, they [.]
that
Co Maurice
will not licence their departure. How[beit]
they have willingly assented
at
w
t
e firste opportuni[tie]
acc
o
plysh
youer desire: to which purpose in like maner I w[.]
required from my
Lordes of
e councell
to urge [.]
verye earnestly. They have taken
e fort before
e [.]
gertrudenbergh and in every mans
opini
o
, yf
e ene[mie]
make not haste, nor wheather he doe, or no, they are lik[e to]
carie it. Theare
weare
were within 120 souldier[.]
Burg
u
dians who abidd a few shotte and p
nt
ly be[.]
[.]
surrendred
e place and went towardes
Antweerp
[with]
their armes and baggage. As touching that w[hich you]
requeste to have better commoditie for
e lodginge of [.]
souldiers,
e councell heere hath written both to yo[ue and]
to
e magistrates, aswell to knowe in what maner,
e [.]
provided at this
present
as to signifie your advise [.]
conerning further order uppon returne of you[.]
I will followe
e matter till I bringe it to effect
[In]
e meane
while
and ever I am youers to commaunde
Hage the 28 March 1593
